image_analysis.description: A single-page letter from the law firm Allred, Maroko & Goldberg. The document is typed in black text on a white background. Several sections of the text, including names, locations, and contact information, have been redacted with black boxes. The letterhead is at the top, the body of the letter is in the center, and footer information, including another office address and a document identifier, is at the bottom.
image_analysis.layout: Standard business letter format. The header contains the law firm's name, address, and contact information. A list of attorneys is on the left, and 'Of Counsel' information is on the right. The date is centered below the header. The recipient's address is on the left, followed by a 'Re:' line. The body of the letter is composed of several paragraphs. A footer contains the New York office address and a document identifier in the bottom right corner.

text_extraction.full_text:
Law Offices
ALLRED, MAROKO & GOLDBERG
A PARTNERSHIP OF PROFESSIONAL CORPORATIONS

NATHAN GOLDBERG*
MICHAEL MAROKO*
GLORIA R. ALLRED*†◊
JOHN S. WEST
DOLORES Y. LEAL
RENEE MOCHKATEL
MARGERY N. SOMERS
MARCUS SPIEGEL
CHRISTINA CHEUNG†
BYRON LAU
KIRBY F. CAÑON
* A PROFESSIONAL CORPORATION
† ALSO ADMITTED TO NEW YORK BAR
◊ ALSO ADMITTED TO WASHINGTON DC BAR

6300 WILSHIRE BOULEVARD
SUITE 1500
LOS ANGELES, CALIFORNIA 90048

FAX
www.amglaw.com

OF COUNSEL
MARÍA G. DÍAZ

E-MAIL:

June 19, 2019

VIA FEDERAL EXPRESS & EMAIL

Mr. Scott Link
Link & Rockenbach, PA
1555 Palm Beach Lakes Blvd., Suite 930
West Palm Beach, FL 33401

Re:

Dear Mr. Link,

We represent [REDACTED] with reference to her claims against Jeffrey Epstein for childhood sexual abuse which occurred in New York City when she was [REDACTED] years old.

New York recently passed the Child Victims Act which creates a 1 year window for claims where the statute of limitations had expired. Therefore, [REDACTED] will be able to sue Mr. Epstein for the sexual abuse which she experienced while she was a minor.

[REDACTED] was the perfect victim.

She was born in [REDACTED] a town on the [REDACTED] coast. When [REDACTED] was four years old, [REDACTED] descended into civil war. At the age of six, her entire village was evacuated. She fled her hometown travelling through war zones on foot with her family, in a stream of refugees.

Her family settled in the outskirts of [REDACTED]. As refugees, with no money, her family lived together in one room, sharing a bathroom with other families. Her parents eventually found low paying, unskilled jobs. Their only clothing was what was provided to them by the Red Cross.

When she was ten years old, [REDACTED] family arrived in [REDACTED].

By the sixth grade, [REDACTED] was 5’10”, beautiful and naturally slim. She desperately

NEW YORK OFFICES | 305 BROADWAY, SUITE 607 | NEW YORK, NEW YORK 10007
T (212) 202-2966 | FAX (212) 202-2967

HOUSE_OVERSIGHT_010560
